revised_title: Observations on Human Mortality Rates in Towns and Rural Areas
tldr: The author examines the difference in mortality rates between towns and rural areas, finding that people in towns tend to have higher mortality rates due to factors like luxury, irregular lifestyles, and poor air quality. The author also discusses the impact of migration on these rates, suggesting that towns have a higher proportion of people in their prime years, while rural areas have more vulnerable populations, such as children and the elderly.
